Text.val: This is the Range for this program. In this case, the Range is defined within the same program,
and View Refresh is used to update the view. However, the Range may also have been set
in a parent task, passed in as a variable, or be hard-coded.
CndRange() is commonly used for efficiency. If no range exists, then the range itself is ignored.
The View Refresh forces the range to reset and the records to be reloaded
when the user changes the tab choice.

ExpSyntax.val: 'DV06: How Do I Define a Range for a Taskâ€™s Data View?'

Text.val: This task writes to two text BLOBS, then reads them into a memory table.
This reads in the blob, using a ':' as a delimiter
